DOC.brief_title: Timing Menstrual Cycle Surgery Treating Premenopausal Women With Stage I , Stage II , Stage III Breast Cancer
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : - Determine timing breast surgery menstrual cycle impact disease recurrence , progression , death among different racial group premenopausal woman stage I , II , III breast cancer . - Determine definitive breast cancer surgery ( e.g. , lumpectomy mastectomy ) perform follicular phase result poor prognosis ( recurrence , disease progression , death ) compare surgery perform midcycle luteal phase patient population . OUTLINE : This multicenter study . Patients undergo either fine needle aspiration concurrently definitive breast surgery ( mastectomy lumpectomy ) needle-directed excisional biopsy follow definitive breast surgery . Patients undergo serum collection hormonal analysis preoperatively , 24 hour post operatively , day 7 14 , 3 month urine collection hormonal analysis begin 24 hour prior surgery continue daily onset next menses . Patients complete 30-minute telephone interview regard medical , family , occupational , reproductive history lifestyle habit ( e.g. , diet , exercise , environmental exposure ) . Beginning 24 hour prior surgery continue onset next menses , patient complete menstrual cycle journal indicate start length menses . Patients undergo mastectomy follow every 3 month 1 year , every 6 month 1 year , annually thereafter . Patients undergo adjuvant therapy follow every 3 month 3 year every 6 month thereafter every 4 month 2 year every 6 month thereafter . PROJECTED ACCRUAL : Approximately 400 patient accrue study within 2.5 year .
